content: White: rook on a1, pawn on b6, king on c8. Black: pawns on a7 and b7, king on a8, bishop on b8. White puts the opponent in zugzwang by playing the rook to a6, after which Black has only two options: take the rook on a6 or move his bishop to any other square on the diagonal b8-h2. In the first case, White advances his pawn from b6 to b7 and checkmates. In the second situation, the white rook takes the black pawn on a7, with the same result.
translations: ita:Bianco﹕ Torre in a1, pedone in b6, re in c8. Nero﹕ pedoni in a7 e b7, re in a8, alfiere in b8. Il Bianco mette l'avversa
